title: Le Potazzine 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Fragrant and polished, this opens with enticing scents of blue flower, red berry, baking spice and an earthy whiff of underbrush. The luminous linear palate offers crunchy red cherry, strawberry, white pepper and orange zest framed in vibrant acidity and silky tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Frenchtown Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Bordeaux and Rhône varieties with Merlot (30%) and Syrah (24%) taking the lead. Aromas of raspberry, dark plum and black fruit are followed by plentiful dark-fruit flavors. It's unabashed in its easy drinking appeal.

title: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle 2013 Château d'Amour Vieilles Vignes  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine Clisson)
description: The cellar of this estate once became a secluded meeting place for lovers, bringing about the name of the wine. This is a mature wine, showing how well Muscadet can develop. Aged for two years on its lees, it has richness as well as plenty of remaining fresh apple fruit. Now at its peak, the wine is ready to drink.
winery: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle

title: Michel Redde et Fils 2014 La Moynerie  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine comes from the producer's home turf in Pouilly. Ripe and round, it shows good potential. Acidity and white fruits are balanced with a touch of minerality. The wine is ready to drink with its warm character and crisp final acidity.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This is a blend from different Premier Cru vineyards in Beaune. At this stage, it is dominated by the wood aging. That gives a bitterness to the wine that needs to soften and allow the ripe fruit to come out. It does have potential, although the maturity will take time. Drink from 2019.

title: Raymond 2013 Generations Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The winery's top-end bottling, this shows dusty, chalky texture and aromas, along with flavors of compost, tea and tobacco. Smoothly full bodied, it weaves savory characteristics of black pepper and cedar that please within the ripeness.

title: Sierra Starr 2013 Old Clone Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Lightly spicy aromas and rich, soothing fruit flavors make this an attractive, lovable and classically proportioned wine. Cherry and raspberry flavors rest on a lightly tannic but smooth texture, and linger on the finish.

title: Simonsig 2012 Redhill Pinotage (Stellenbosch)
description: This is a pronounced wine, boasting upfront aromas of blackberry, plum and boysenberry that are graced with additional scents of licorice, chicory, black pepper and crushed violet. The palate is bold, with a gripping texture that supports the lush black-fruit flavors. Toasted oak and sweet smoke accents grace the medium-length finish. Drink now–2020.

title: St. Supéry 2013 Élu Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of all five red Bordeaux varieties, with Cabernet Sauvignon taking the lead position at 65% and Merlot following at 22%. It shows classic characteristics of tart red currant, dried herb and cigar box within a full-bodied richness that's seamlessly smooth.

title: Villa Spinosa 2008  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, blue flower and spiced plum emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers black currant, espresso, tobacco and vanilla while fine-grained tannins provide support.

title: Swiftwater Cellars 2013 Proprietary Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of the five Bordeaux varieties. It's aromatically reserved, with notes of flowers, high-toned herbs, wood spice and dark fruit, but it's not yet fully ready to reveal its charms. The flavors are dark and dense, with chewy, lightly dry tannins providing support. The finish stretches-out.

title: Tablas Creek 2015 Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Yellow melon and yellow-peach aromas meet with a touch of honey, apple blossom and wet cement on the nose of this bottling. Pleasant and elegant on the sip, this shows poached apples and bright citrus flavors, with an Asian-pear warmth in the midpalate and a crispy tension.

title: Yves Leccia 2013 E Croce Red (Patrimonio)
description: This wine is full, structured and still developing, with a bitter-chocolate edge that give a sharp character. This is balanced with warmer black-fruit flavors and acidity. The wine has great potential and needs another year. It will be best from the end of 2017.

title: Trust 2013 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Fragrant aromas of mortared herbs, violets and red fruit lead to velvety soft red and blue-fruit flavors. It's a very pretty wine that shows a fine sense of precision.

title: Buttonwood 2015 Musqué Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)
description: Refreshing on the nose, this clonal study shows lively and tropical aromas of Asian pear, guava, Meyer-lemon skin and that characteristic grassy note. It's racy on the palate, where green-apple rinds meet with lime skins, cement and crushed white rocks.

title: Ca' Rugate 2015 San Michele  (Soave Classico)
description: Aromas of white wild flower and chamomile float out of the glass along with a whiff of orchard fruit. The ripe round palate offers juicy Bartlett pear, golden apple and peach. A note of bitter almond wraps up the finish.

title: Cantina del Castello 2015 Castello  (Soave Classico)
description: Aromas of exotic fruit, white spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the nose while the round creamy palate doles out apricot, mineral, chopped herb and nectarine. A mineral vein lifts the finish.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Cold Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of black fruit, spiced plum, vanilla and herb lead to full dark fruit flavors. It shows a lot of ripeness but keeps it in balance.

title: Chronic Cellars 2014 Purple Paradise Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 77% Zinfandel, 14% Syrah, 8% Petite Sirah and 1% Grenache is a solid choice at this price. Vibrant fruit tones of strawberry, cranberry, black raspberry and mulberry mix with exotic vanilla and clove on the nose. Juicy and fresh flavors of pine-smoked blackberries give a peat-like character to the palate.

title: Clos Venturi 2013 Pur Sciaccarellu Sciaccerellu (Corse)
description: This widely found local grape has produced a crisp, wine full complex berry and black fruits that are balanced with tannins. Richly structured, the wine is held together by the tannins and by the bright acidity typical of the grape. Drink now.

title: Clos Venturi 2015 Rosé (Corse)
description: More deeply colored than the current fashion for pale rosés, this wine also has plenty of flavor. It offers juicy red-berry fruits, orange juice, and a crisp, direct texture. It is meant to go with food.

title: Clos Venturi 2015 Vermentino (Corse)
description: Eight months on lees before bottling give this wine its rich, concentrated character. Melon and green-plum fruits are poised and stylish, pointed up by a touch of pepper. It is ripe, full bodied, ready to drink in 2017.

title: Columbia Crest 2013 Beverly Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vineyard designated Cabernet Francs are an extreme rarity in the state. This one brings aromas of plum, herb, vanilla and pencil lead that are followed by pillow-soft fruit flavors. The variety doesn't always show through but it provides enjoyment.

title: Conde de Velázquez 2013 El Conde Gran Reserva Red (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Ripe aromas of cassis and prune are woodsy and smell a touch like marzipan. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Carmenère feels wide and cushioned by chewy tannins and a plush body. Flavors of herbal berry fruits, baked plum and savory spices finish long, with attractive notes of licorice, baking spices and pepper.

title: Cono Sur 2015 Single Vineyard Block No. 10 Loma Roja Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Snappy, chiseled and defined by fresh grass and citrus aromas on the nose, this is textbook Casablanca SB. Flavors of tarragon, sage, lime and citrus peel finish with a lasting wave of mild pyrazinic bitterness and tangy citrus.
designation: Single Vineyard Block No. 10 Loma Roja

title: Coopers Creek 2014 Chardonnay (Gisborne)
description: For years, Gisborne was known as the Chardonnay capital of New Zealand, so it's nice to see that region's product being given some overdue international recognition via this label. In the glass, the wine is subtly toasty and mealy, yet loaded with peach and citrus fruit, carried by plenty of weight and a full, rich, velvety texture. Drink now.

title: Corteforte 2008 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Forest floor, resin, exotic spice, steeped plum and a balsamic note lead the way on this robust red. The firmly structured palate offers raisin, dried cherry, licorice and coffee framed in tightly wound, close-grained tannins.

title: Decoy 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This impressive, larger-production wine is forested and savory in compost. It offers a medium-bodied imprint of molasses, citrus and deep, dark tannin.

title: Château de Tracy 2014  Pouilly-Fumé
description: From one of the oldest estates in Pouilly Fumé, this is an herbal and freshly grassy wine. Delicious apple is textured with minerality, salty character and intense, still-young acidity. It's ready to drink although it will be better from 2017.

title: Accordini Igino 2011 Le Bessole  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Aromas of ripe raspberry jam, plum, menthol and baking spice lead the nose on this bold red. The dense palate delivers raisin, dried black cherry and licorice alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
